text: <!channel> For those in the meeting with Scott yesterday, do you recall if he said the checkmark/completed badge is used for workouts that we do not currently have an icon for. For example, is someone did martial arts, would the checkmark be used?
yes, that’s the intention of the check
Thanks!
hey <!channel> does anyone here have a PSD or high(ish) res image of Chameleon? Doesn’t need to be super current

<@U0MKH0BE0|melodee> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/melodee/F2EBZQSJ0/screen_shot_2016-09-21_at_12.23.26_pm.png|Screen Shot 2016-09-21 at 12.23.26 PM.png> and commented: <!channel>: From a discussion in the core channel, I’ve explored text and button placement on the Sign Up screen.
• Changed the text to “have an account already? Log in” and moved under the sign up CTA
• Shortened the text in CTA to “sign up"
• Using the stacked logo to fill the space

initial_comment.comment:

<!channel> I’m working on bringing the final icons into the prototype Elise made and thought I’d share how they are looking in context of the app. Something I did notice was some icons were much wider then I expected, so to keep the scale the same as what I showed yesterday the max with is actually 40px at 2X, not 34px. If the few icons that are extra wide feel off, we can go back and adjust them. We can also see if we feel the completed icon needs to be adjusted.

<https://www.dropbox.com/sh/4bymnicdvz2rhtw/AACDdkHdPWfMDXpfwGIXmtYma?dl=0>
Thanks Matt for posting the files.
Thanks Melodee for posting your screens. Selecting one of them really depends on when and where they appear. Will wait for Megan to respond.
digging how the icons look in the app
yeah the new icons are looking nice <@U0XCJ372R>, whenever you land on a final choice, could you share the psd that has the home screens so i can update my motion clips for the prototype?
Sure Trent. Do the icons feel balanced to you, or do some feel too big/small/heavy/etc?
how about the tick?
It didn’t bother me on the home screen, but in the add workout screens it feels very heavy.

the icons look good to me. but i’m not sure i can speak to how they align to what was discussed and decided yesterday with how subtle the differences are. are these ones much different than the sample comp the group landed on? did the changes you’re referring to cause them to be closer to the largest sample comp instead?
No, they are the same. Just a few icons that I had not used in the tests I showed yesterday are slightly wider then I had anticipated.

<@U0XCJ372R|ali> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/ali/F2EDTHZMX/21_addworkout_-_small_icons.png|21_AddWorkout - Small Icons.png> and commented: The add working screens might just need to have the icons cut at a smaller scale.

initial_comment.comment: The add working screens might just need to have the icons cut at a smaller scale.

text:
Ah I see. I actually kind of like the smaller icons when they’re paired with the labels like that. Which also brings me to another thing I’ve been meaning to ask <@U02AUNA0P>… 

Did you intend for icons in the summary list/drawer to be smaller than the ones standing alone on the nav bar? All the files I’ve worked with to make my motion samples had a smaller scale on the summary and was wondering if we should keep doing that like this mockup right here :point_up_2:
In the comps I just made I kept them at the same scale. I feel like the icons need to be smaller when they are in-line with the text like in the Add Workout section. Curious what Phillip thinks…
<@U026E0ZNR>, let’s make them the same size. i think they changed slightly when the home screen went through a few makeovers/tweaks where the drawer design was pretty set in stone for a while.
^ having the drawer icons bump up to the same scale as the nav bar ones btw
<@U0HPGQ4KH> and <@U026PLK4S> would you guys mind weighing in on the size/scale of the icons as  Ali asked? Scott is asking for the specs needed for those icons
they look good to me too. I’m with the crew on the smaller “add workout” icons. think everything looks great.
the tick is still too thick for me across the board. Ali, can you try to thin it out a little bit?
Will do

Sure, I can share all that with everyone, just give me a moment.
Are we liking the thinner checkmark?
Looks like Matt is in a meeting atm so we may need to hear feedback from him when he’s out at 3:30

Looking good Melodee
<@U0XCJ372R> yes!
Thanks matt
it seems closer to the thickness of the “strength and flex” icon shapes.
Yeah. It’s amazing what shaving off a pixel can do.

<@U0260V1BX|melissa> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/melissa/F2EEL5BNG/4.11_dx_history.png|4.11 Dx History.png> and commented: One thing I was thinking about as we were discussing this yesterday was how we might be able to use the space below the Dx Tile to hold this icon. Looking at this screen, and knowing that we are repurposing the check elsewhere, maybe there's an opportunity to have the pillar icon represented down there... maybe grey + pillar name before the user has enrolled, and pink + # sessions completed once the user has participated in it? That would match to the icons that the user sees in the activity bar. Just a thought on how we might avoid adding another element over the photo.

initial_comment.comment: One thing I was thinking about as we were discussing this yesterday was how we might be able to use the space below the Dx Tile to hold this icon. Looking at this screen, and knowing that we are repurposing the check elsewhere, maybe there's an opportunity to have the pillar icon represented down there... maybe grey + pillar name before the user has enrolled, and pink + # sessions completed once the user has participated in it? That would match to the icons that the user sees in the activity bar. Just a thought on how we might avoid adding another element over the photo.

text: if we do decide to go with over-photo placement, I would just want to make sure we’re doing it consistently across applications
The over photo placement on home and discovery feels a little cluttered to me, so I like the possibility of the icon below
Having the icon below might make problems for overlapping cards on the home screen
and for the overview page, maybe it can live below the join button, outside of the photo area?
Good point melodee. The icon over balance bowls worried me the most. It works ok on some photos but not all.

true, i’d still agree with megan on it feeling a little cluttered. The photos should be the hero and everything else we overlay detracts from all of the nice whitespace we are hoping to have in those photos.

I also wanted to keep some consistency in the placement between library dx and regular dx by keeping on the image because there’s not really a place for it to live in the library dx overview below the image
i wonder if these icons are even needed for discoveries the user is enrolled in...
<@U0HP6TFNX> thoughts?
the icons seem like a nice visual tag to help users understand what pillar this discovery is meant to focus on
I like the consistency of showing them everywhere
it could just live with description content… in the same way that we’d planned on saying “because you want to lose weight and increase focus"
I could see an argument for that
i could go either way, honestly, just trying to think through why we’d show the icon and when. Would it also show up on Dx reminders, for instance
